extendedIngredients.name: chicken broth
extendedIngredients.originalString: 5-6 cups chicken broth (depending on if you want it a bit soupy)
metaInformation: (depending on if you want it a bit soupy)

extendedIngredients.name: great northern beans
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 (15.3 ounce) cans Northern White beans, drained

extendedIngredients.name: poblano pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 poblano pepper, diced (if you want REALLY spicy, substitute serrano chilis for the poplano, or leave the seeds in from the jalapeno peppers. If you want less spicy, leave the seeds out)
metaInformation: for the poplano, or leave the seeds in from the jalapeno peppers. if you want less spicy, leave the seeds out)

extendedIngredients.name: salsa verde
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups salsa verde (I chose jalapeno salsa verde for an even spicier chili!)

extendedIngredients.name: shredded chicken
extendedIngredients.originalString: 6 cups cooked shredded chicken (I used rotisserie chicken)

recipes.title: (Easy) Spicy White Chicken Chili

winePairing.pairingText: Cava, Grenache, and Shiraz are my top picks for Chicken Chili. These juicy reds don't have too much tannin (important for spicy foods), but a sparkling wine like cava can tame the heat even better. You could try Poema Brut Cava. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 11 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Poema Brut Cava
productMatches.description: Vibrant aromas of ripe peaches, pears and toasted bread with a hint of spice fill the nose. The palate is dry with a rich, creamy texture. Layers of flavor include orange rind and spice that persists through an elegant finish.

recipes.instructions: Heat onion, peppers, and garlic in a large skillet over medium/high heat until the onions are transparent.Add all of the ingredients (except garnish) to a medium pot and bring to a boil. Cover and reduce to a simmer, cooking for 5-10 minutes at least on simmer.Serve hot garnished with sour cream, shredded cheese, and more peppers if desired. Enjoy!

steps.step: Heat onion, peppers, and garlic in a large skillet over medium/high heat until the onions are transparent.
Add all of the ingredients (except garnish) to a medium pot and bring to a boil. Cover and reduce to a simmer, cooking for 5-10 minutes at least on simmer.
Serve hot garnished with sour cream, shredded cheese, and more peppers if desired. Enjoy!
